description.zh-cn: 1933年至1945年由阿道夫·希特勒和纳粹党统治下的德国，正式国号为德意志国，后改为大德意志国。
description.en: The common name for Germany from 1933 to 1945, when it was governed by Adolf Hitler and the Nazi Party. Its official name was the German Reich, later the Greater German Reich.

description.zh-cn: 奥地利裔德国政治人物，纳粹党党魁，1933年至1945年担任德国总理，1934年至1945年亦任纳粹德国元首。
description.en: An Austrian-born German politician who was the dictator of Germany from 1933 to 1945. He rose to power as the leader of the Nazi Party, becoming Chancellor in 1933 and then Führer in 1934.

nodes.id: 国家社会主义德意志劳工党

zh-cn: 国家社会主义德意志劳工党

description.zh-cn: 一个活跃于1920年至1945年间的德国极右翼政党，在希特勒的领导下于1933年成为德国的执政党。
description.en: A far-right political party in Germany active between 1920 and 1945, that created and supported the ideology of Nazism. Under Adolf Hitler's leadership, the party became the ruling party of Germany in 1933.

description.zh-cn: 德国军事家和政治家，魏玛共和国第二任总统。1933年，他任命阿道夫·希特勒为德国总理。
description.en: A German military officer and statesman who served as the second president of Germany during the Weimar Republic. In 1933, he appointed Adolf Hitler as Chancellor of Germany.

description.zh-cn: 1918年至1933年间存在的德国共和联邦制政体，在纳粹党掌权后被纳粹德国所取代。
description.en: The federal republic and semi-presidential representative democracy established in 1918 in Germany to replace the German Empire. It was succeeded by Nazi Germany after the Nazi seizure of power in 1933.

nodes.id: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

zh-cn: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战中对抗轴心国的国家联盟。
description.en: The alliance of countries that opposed the Axis powers during the Second World War.

description.zh-cn: 1933年2月27日德国国会大厦发生的火灾，被纳粹党用作镇压政治异议、巩固权力的借口。
description.en: An arson attack on the Reichstag building in Berlin on 27 February 1933, used by the Nazi Party as a pretext to suppress political dissent and consolidate power.

description.zh-cn: 1933年3月23日通过的魏玛宪法修正案，该法案使希特勒及其内阁能够不经国会或总统同意而颁布法律，有效地将德国转变为独裁国家。
description.en: A 1933 Weimar Constitution amendment that gave the German Cabinet—in effect, Chancellor Adolf Hitler—the power to enact laws without the involvement of the Reichstag, effectively turning Germany into a dictatorship.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹政权于1934年发起的一场政治清洗行动，旨在清除冲锋队及其领导人恩斯特·罗姆，以及其他政治对手。
description.en: A political purge that took place in Nazi Germany in 1934, targeting the Sturmabteilung (SA) and its leader Ernst Röhm, as well as other political opponents.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹党早期成员，冲锋队的联合创始人及指挥官，在“长刀之夜”中被处决。
description.en: An early member of the Nazi Party, co-founder and commander of the Sturmabteilung (SA), who was executed during the Night of the Long Knives.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹党的原始准军事组织，在“长刀之夜”后其影响力被大幅削弱。
description.en: The original paramilitary wing of the Nazi Party. Its influence was greatly diminished after the Night of the Long Knives.

description.zh-cn: 1938年3月纳粹德国吞并奥地利联邦国的事件。
description.en: The annexation of the Federal State of Austria into the German Reich in March 1938.

description.zh-cn: 在1938年德奥合并前存在的奥地利国家。
description.en: The Austrian state that existed prior to the Anschluss with Nazi Germany in 1938.

description.zh-cn: 1938年德国、英国、法国和意大利签署的协议，允许德国吞并捷克斯洛伐克的苏台德地区。
description.en: An agreement signed in 1938 by Germany, the United Kingdom, France, and Italy that permitted German annexation of the Sudetenland in western Czechoslovakia.

nodes.id: 捷克斯洛伐克历史 (1918年–38年)

zh-cn: 捷克斯洛伐克历史 (1918年–38年)

description.zh-cn: 存在于1918年至1938年间的捷克斯洛伐克国家，在《慕尼黑协定》后被迫割让苏台德地区。
description.en: The state of Czechoslovakia existing from 1918 to 1938, which was forced to cede the Sudetenland after the Munich Agreement.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹德国与苏联之间签署的互不侵犯条约，其中包含一项秘密议定书，划分了双方在东欧的势力范围。
description.en: A non-aggression pact between Nazi Germany and the Soviet Union, which contained a secret protocol dividing Eastern Europe into spheres of influence.

description.zh-cn: 一个存在于1922年至1991年间的欧亚大陆社会主义国家。
description.en: A socialist state in Eurasia that existed from 1922 to 1991.

description.zh-cn: 1939年德国和苏联对波兰的入侵，标志着第二次世界大战在欧洲的爆发。
description.en: The invasion of Poland by Germany and the Soviet Union in 1939, which marked the beginning of World War II in Europe.

description.zh-cn: 一场涉及全球绝大多数国家的全球性战争，分为轴心国和同盟国两大对立阵营。
description.en: A global war that involved the vast majority of the world's countries—including all of the great powers—forming two opposing military alliances: the Allies and the Axis.

description.zh-cn: 1941年6月22日，轴心国入侵苏联的代号。
description.en: The code name for the Axis invasion of the Soviet Union, which started on 22 June 1941.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战东线战场的重大战役，被认为是战争的转折点。
description.en: A major battle on the Eastern Front of World War II, widely regarded as the turning point of the war.

description.zh-cn: 1944年6月6日盟军在诺曼底的登陆行动，开辟了欧洲西线战场。
description.en: The Allied landing operations in Normandy on 6 June 1944, which opened a Western Front in Europe.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战欧洲战场的最后一次重大战役，导致了希特勒自杀和纳粹德国的最终投降。
description.en: The final major battle in Europe during World War II, resulting in Hitler's suicide and the final surrender of Nazi Germany.

description.zh-cn: 1945年5月7日德国国防军最高统帅部签署的法律文件，标志着第二次世界大战欧洲战场的结束。
description.en: The legal document signed on May 7, 1945, by the German High Command that effected the end of World War II in Europe.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战期间，纳粹德国及其合作者对约六百万欧洲犹太人进行的种族灭绝。
description.en: The genocide of European Jews during World War II by Nazi Germany and its collaborators, resulting in the deaths of approximately six million Jews.

description.zh-cn: 一个源于古代近东闪米特人的民族和宗教群体。
description.en: An ethnoreligious group and nation originating from the Israelites of the ancient Near East.

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战后由同盟国举行的一系列军事法庭，旨在审判纳粹德国的战争罪行。
description.en: A series of military tribunals held by the Allied forces after World War II to prosecute war crimes committed by Nazi Germany.

description.zh-cn: 德国海军元帅，在希特勒自杀后接任德国总统，领导弗伦斯堡政府直至其解散。
description.en: A German admiral who, after Hitler's suicide, briefly succeeded him as President of Germany, leading the Flensburg Government until its dissolution.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹德国国民教育与宣传部部长，希特勒最亲密的伙伴之一。在希特勒自杀后曾短暂担任总理。
description.en: The Reich Minister of Propaganda of Nazi Germany and one of Adolf Hitler's closest associates. He briefly served as Chancellor after Hitler's suicide.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹党领导下的主要准军事组织，在海因里希·希姆莱的领导下，负责执行纳粹德国的种族政策，包括犹太人大屠杀。
description.en: A major paramilitary organization under the Nazi Party. Under the command of Heinrich Himmler, it was responsible for enforcing the racial policy of Nazi Germany, including the Holocaust.

description.zh-cn: 党卫队全国领袖，纳粹德国的主要领导人之一，是犹太人大屠杀的主要策划者。
description.en: Reichsführer of the Schutzstaffel (SS) and a leading member of the Nazi Party. He was one of the main architects of the Holocaust.

description.zh-cn: 1933年1月30日，魏玛共和国总统保罗·冯·兴登堡任命希特勒为德国总理。
description.en: On 30 January 1933, Weimar Republic President Paul von Hindenburg appointed Hitler as Chancellor of Germany.

relationships.target: 国家社会主义德意志劳工党

description.zh-cn: 阿道夫·希特勒是国家社会主义德意志劳工党（纳粹党）的领导人（元首）。
description.en: Adolf Hitler was the leader (Führer) of the National Socialist German Workers' Party (Nazi Party).

description.zh-cn: 1934年8月2日兴登堡去世后，希特勒将总理和总统职权合一，成为纳粹德国的独裁者，头衔为“元首及帝国总理”。
description.en: After Hindenburg's death on 2 August 1934, Hitler merged the offices of Chancellor and President to become the dictator of Nazi Germany, with the title 'Führer and Reich Chancellor'.

relationships.source: 国家社会主义德意志劳工党

description.zh-cn: 国家社会主义德意志劳工党在1933年掌权，建立了纳粹德国政权。
description.en: The National Socialist German Workers' Party came to power in 1933, establishing the Nazi German regime.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹党于1933年掌权，取代了魏玛共和国。
description.en: The Nazi Party seized power in 1933, replacing the Weimar Republic.

relationships.source: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

description.zh-cn: 同盟国在第二次世界大战中与纳粹德国作战，并最终将其击败。
description.en: The Allied Powers fought against and ultimately defeated Nazi Germany in World War II.

relationships.target: 国家社会主义德意志劳工党

description.zh-cn: 纳粹党宣称国会纵火案是共产党举事的前兆，并以此为由清除政治反对力量，巩固其权力。
description.en: The Nazi Party claimed the Reichstag fire was a precursor to a communist uprising and used it as a pretext to eliminate political opposition and consolidate its power.

relationships.source: 国家社会主义德意志劳工党

description.zh-cn: 纳粹党利用其在国会的多数地位以及对反对派的镇压，通过了《授权法》。
description.en: The Nazi Party used its majority in the Reichstag and suppression of opposition to pass the Enabling Act.

description.zh-cn: 《授权法》允许希特勒及其政府能够不需要国会同意而通过任何法案，有效地赋予其独裁权力。
description.en: The Enabling Act allowed Hitler and his government to pass any law without the consent of the Reichstag, effectively granting him dictatorial powers.

description.zh-cn: 希特勒下令执行“长刀之夜”行动，以清除冲锋队领导层及其他政敌。
description.en: Hitler ordered the 'Night of the Long Knives' to eliminate the leadership of the SA and other political opponents.

description.zh-cn: 冲锋队领导人恩斯特·罗姆在“长刀之夜”中被处决。
description.en: SA leader Ernst Röhm was executed during the Night of the Long Knives.

description.zh-cn: 在“长刀之夜”清洗之后，冲锋队失去了其政治地位和影响力。
description.en: After the purge of the Night of the Long Knives, the SA lost its political status and influence.

description.zh-cn: 1938年3月12日，德军进入奥地利，实现了德奥合并。
description.en: On 12 March 1938, German troops entered Austria, effecting the Anschluss.

description.zh-cn: 德奥合并导致奥地利联邦国被吞并，成为纳粹德国的一部分。
description.en: The Anschluss led to the annexation of the Federal State of Austria, which became part of Nazi Germany.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹德国通过战争威胁，促成了《慕尼黑协定》的签署。
description.en: Nazi Germany, through the threat of war, pushed for the signing of the Munich Agreement.

relationships.target: 捷克斯洛伐克历史 (1918年–38年)

description.zh-cn: 《慕尼黑协定》迫使捷克斯洛伐克将苏台德地区割让给德国。
description.en: The Munich Agreement forced Czechoslovakia to cede the Sudetenland to Germany.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹德国与苏联签署了《苏德互不侵犯条约》，以确保在入侵波兰时苏联不会干预。
description.en: Nazi Germany signed the Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact with the Soviet Union to ensure Soviet non-intervention in the invasion of Poland.

description.zh-cn: 苏联与纳粹德国签署了《苏德互不侵犯条约》，其中秘密议定书划分了双方在东欧的势力范围。
description.en: The Soviet Union signed the Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact with Nazi Germany, which included a secret protocol dividing Eastern Europe into spheres of influence.

description.zh-cn: 1939年9月1日，纳粹德国入侵波兰。
description.en: On September 1, 1939, Nazi Germany invaded Poland.

description.zh-cn: 德国入侵波兰标志着第二次世界大战在欧洲的爆发。
description.en: The German invasion of Poland marked the beginning of World War II in Europe.

description.zh-cn: 1941年6月22日，纳粹德国发动“巴巴罗萨行动”，入侵苏联。
description.en: On 22 June 1941, Nazi Germany launched Operation Barbarossa, the invasion of the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 德国发动“巴巴罗萨行动”入侵苏联，撕毁了《苏德互不侵犯条约》。
description.en: Germany's launch of Operation Barbarossa, invading the Soviet Union, broke the Molotov–Ribbentrop Pact.

description.zh-cn: 德国在斯大林格勒战役中战败是东线战场的转折点，苏联开始向西部推进。
description.en: The German defeat at the Battle of Stalingrad was the turning point on the Eastern Front, after which the Soviet Union began its advance westward.

relationships.source: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

description.zh-cn: 1944年6月6日，同盟国军队在诺曼底登陆，开辟了欧洲西线战场。
description.en: On June 6, 1944, Allied forces landed in Normandy, opening a Western Front in Europe.

description.zh-cn: 在柏林战役的最后阶段，随着苏军逼近，希特勒在地堡中自杀。
description.en: During the final stages of the Battle of Berlin, with Soviet troops approaching, Hitler committed suicide in his bunker.

description.zh-cn: 1945年5月7日，德国国防军最高统帅部签署了无条件投降书。
description.en: On May 7, 1945, the German High Command signed the instrument of unconditional surrender.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹德国策划并实施了对欧洲犹太人的系统性种族灭绝，即犹太人大屠杀。
description.en: Nazi Germany planned and executed the systematic genocide of European Jews, known as the Holocaust.

description.zh-cn: 约有六百万犹太人在大屠杀中被杀害。
description.en: Approximately six million Jews were murdered in the Holocaust.

relationships.source: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战后，同盟国组织了纽伦堡审判，以审判纳粹领导人的战争罪行。
description.en: After World War II, the Allied powers organized the Nuremberg trials to prosecute Nazi leaders for war crimes.

relationships.target: 国家社会主义德意志劳工党

description.zh-cn: 纽伦堡审判对纳粹党的多名高级官员进行了审判并判处其罪名成立，同时宣布纳粹党为犯罪组织。
description.en: The Nuremberg trials prosecuted and convicted many high-ranking officials of the Nazi Party, which was declared a criminal organization.

description.zh-cn: 自1929年起，海因里希·希姆莱担任党卫队全国领袖。
description.en: From 1929, Heinrich Himmler served as Reichsführer-SS, the commander of the Schutzstaffel.

description.zh-cn: 党卫队是执行犹太人大屠杀的主要组织，负责管理集中营和灭绝营，并组织别动队进行大规模屠杀。
description.en: The SS was the primary organization responsible for carrying out the Holocaust, managing concentration and extermination camps, and organizing the Einsatzgruppen for mass killings.
